body:
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.com/kandayo/likee.cr.svg?branch=main)](https://travis-ci.com/kandayo/likee.cr)

# Likee.cr

Unofficial Likee API wrapper for Crystal.

## Disclaimer

This lib is in no way affiliated with, authorized, maintained or endorsed by
Likee or any of its affiliates or subsidiaries.

This is purely an educational proof of concept.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
 likee:
   github: kandayo/likee.cr
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

For more examples, please refer to the [**documentation**](https://kandayo.github.io/likee.cr/).

```crystal
require "likee"

Likee.get_user_post(user_id: "XXXXX")
```

## Endpoints

- getUserVideo
- getUserPost

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/kandayo/likee.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [kandayo](https://github.com/kandayo) - creator and maintainer

def.name: get_user_post
def.body: client.get_user_post(user_id: user_id, last_post_id: last_post_id, count: count)

types.name: Client
types.doc: The `Client` that consumes the Likee API.

instance_methods.name: get_user_post
instance_methods.doc:
Fetches the posts of *user_id*. The parameters *last_post_id* and *count*
may be used to paginate.

def.name: get_user_post
def.body:
params = HTTP::Params.build do |url|
  url.add("currentUrl", Utils.random_profile_url)
  url.add("u", user_id)
  url.add("last_postid", last_post_id)
  url.add("count", count.to_s)
end
response_body = request("/live/share/getUserPost", params)
(Likee::Mapping::PostList.from_json(response_body)).normalize

types.name: Mapping
types.doc:
The `Mapping` module is the namespace that contains the structs that
represent data returned from the Likee API.
types.summary: The Mapping module is the namespace that contains the structs that represent data returned from the Likee API.

types.name: Post
types.doc:
The `Post` struct defines how to parse a post returned from *getUserPost*
endpoint.
types.summary: The Post struct defines how to parse a post returned from getUserPost endpoint.

def.name: normalize
def.body: Likee::Video.new(id: post_id, published_at: upload_date, creator_id: nil, sound_id: nil, title: name, description: description, play_count: nil, like_count: nil, comment_count: nil, share_count: nil, height: nil, width: nil, thumbnail_url: thumbnail_url, website_url: url, share_url: share_url, video_url: content_url)

types.name: PostList
types.doc:
The `PostList` struct defines how to parse a collection of posts returned
from *getUserPost* endpoint.
types.summary: The PostList struct defines how to parse a collection of posts returned from getUserPost endpoint.

constants.name: OPERATING_SYSTEMS
constants.value: ["Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_5", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_6", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_6_6", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_5", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_3", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_3", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_6_8", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_3", "Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_11_5", "Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64", "Windows NT 10.0; WOW64", "Windows NT 10.0"]

class_methods.name: random_profile_url
class_methods.doc: Generates a random user profile url.

class_methods.name: random_user_agent
class_methods.doc:
Generates a random user agent string.
Heavily inspired by https://github.com/drawrowfly/tiktok-scraper.

def.name: random_user_agent
def.body:
os = OPERATING_SYSTEMS.sample
chrome_major = ((Random.rand(0..1)) * 3) + 85
chrome_version = ((Random.rand(0..1)) * 190) + 4100
chrome_patch = ((Random.rand(0..1)) * 50) + 140
"Mozilla/5.0 (#{os}) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/#{chrome_major}.0.#{chrome_version}.#{chrome_patch} Safari/537.36"

types.name: Video
types.doc: A `Video` represents a video or post returned by an API call.
types.summary: A Video represents a video or post returned by an API call.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (id, published_at, creator_id, sound_id, title, description, play_count, like_count, comment_count, share_count, height, width, thumbnail_url, website_url, share_url, video_url)
constructors.args_html: (id, published_at, creator_id, sound_id, title, description, play_count, like_count, comment_count, share_count, height, width, thumbnail_url, website_url, share_url, video_url)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(id, published_at, creator_id, sound_id, title, description, play_count, like_count, comment_count, share_count, height, width, thumbnail_url, website_url, share_url, video_url)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: download_url
instance_methods.doc: Extracts the URL to the video without the watermark.
instance_methods.summary: Extracts the URL to the video without the watermark.

types.name: VideoCollection
types.doc:
A `VideoCollection` represents a collection of videos returned by an API
call. The array of `Video` can be accessed with `#videos`.
types.summary: A VideoCollection represents a collection of videos returned by an API call.

instance_methods.name: last_post_id
instance_methods.doc: Returns the last video id, useful to paginate the user feed.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the last video id, useful to paginate the user feed.
